page.title: 19Penllwyn Isaf Farm
page.content: There has been a farm in Penllwyn Isaf since the 17th century. Today it is farmed by Mr. John Phillips and his two sons. It is a 150-acre dairy farm with 200 cows. The farmer's day begins at 7 a.m. when the cows are milked and fed. He uses many labour saving machines such as{tractors, bailers, drill, mower, {cultivator, side-rake and milking- and {feeding- machines.} Many of the fields have names e.g. Ca'r Allt, Cae Top, Ty-mawr, The meadows and Well field. Once a fortnight the farmer goes to the mart in Carmarthen to buy and sell cattle, and discuss current ideas and trends with other farmers.
